cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north overnight, then north-northeast on Friday, tracking toward the central Louisiana coast and then inland across Louisiana into Arkansas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast near Cameron to Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of the mouth of the Pearl River to Bay St. Louis, Mississippi (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: West of High Island to Sargent, TX and east of Morgan City, LA to the mouth of the Pearl River including New Orleans, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas (Tropical Storm Warning); High Island, TX to Morgan City, LA (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Louisiana coastline, parts of upper Texas coast and Mississippi coast within storm surge and wind impact zones
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) likely Friday morning through early Saturday with a low (≤6 %) chance of sustained 50-kt winds. Gusts could reach hurricane force in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft possible in the Mississippi River, Lake Pontchartrain and Maurepas; 3–5 ft possible from Port Fourchon westward, leading to minor inundation along the river terminals.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain with locally higher amounts up to 15 inches possible, producing flash and river flooding near port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible in outer rain bands; dangerous rip currents and elevated waves may restrict vessel movements.
